philosophy.title: // Right to History
philosophy.definition: The Right to History means: an actor spends their own energy to initiate an action, writes the outcome into verifiable world state, and leaves an indelible trace. This right is inalienable, non-delegable, and irrevocable.
philosophy.p_desc: Human or Agent. Humans exist unconditionally; agents exist conditionally.
philosophy.e_desc: Universal cost metric for actions. Anchored to hardware INT8 TOPS, not arbitrary tokens.
philosophy.s_desc: All persistent reality and verifiable history. S' = f(S, A, E).
philosophy.formula: The system advances by action, not by time.
philosophy.committer: The system must have a single committer — a structural role, not a moral authority.

steps.validate_desc: Check actor status, boundary permissions, action format
steps.quote_desc: Compute energy cost of the action
steps.settle_desc: Finalize energy accounting incl. I/O overhead
steps.append_desc: Write to append-only log + cryptographic hash

showcase.title: // Built with PunkGo
showcase.subtitle: Projects forged on the kernel. Each one writes its own history.

watchdog.name: WATCHDOG
watchdog.desc: Creation process provenance. Watches your files, submits every change to the kernel's append-only log with Merkle proofs. Not just proving a file exists — proving when and how it came into being.

agent.name: AGENT
agent.desc: Auditable LLM agent. Every AI response is committed to the kernel's append-only log with SHA-256 artifact hashes. Hold rules intercept high-risk actions for human approval. Energy envelopes cap resource consumption. Not just running AI — proving what it did.

whitepaper.title: // PunkGo Whitepaper
whitepaper.epigraph: When AI does everything for you, who proves you still exist?
whitepaper.intro: PunkGo is a local sovereignty compute kernel: giving individuals the inalienable right to write history on their own hardware.
whitepaper.s1_body: An actor spends its own energy to initiate actions, commits results to verifiable world state, and leaves an indelible trace.
whitepaper.s2_intro: The system is composed of three primitive objects:
whitepaper.s2_e_desc: Energy, the universal cost metric for actions
whitepaper.s2_s_desc: State, all persistent reality and history, including the verifiable structure of how history was written
whitepaper.s2_advance: The system advances by action, not by time:
whitepaper.s2_actions: Where A is an atomic action initiated by P: observe (read), create (create), mutate (modify), execute (execute, must be encapsulated with recordable input/output).
whitepaper.s2_committer: The system MUST have a unique Committer — a structural role, not a moral authority — responsible for turning Actions into committed events, providing a single linearization commit point.
